description:
L2_NovaRegistry.areTokensRemoved(bytes32) (contracts/L2_NovaRegistry.sol#353-386) uses a dangerous strict equality:
	- removalTimestamp == 0 (contracts/L2_NovaRegistry.sol#356)

L2_NovaRegistry.areTokensRemoved(bytes32) (contracts/L2_NovaRegistry.sol#353-386) uses a dangerous strict equality:
	- uncleDeathTimestamp == 1 (contracts/L2_NovaRegistry.sol#369)

L2_NovaRegistry.isCanceled(bytes32) (contracts/L2_NovaRegistry.sol#391-403) uses a dangerous strict equality:
	- cancelTimestamp == 0 (contracts/L2_NovaRegistry.sol#394)

	State variables written after the call(s):
	- requestTokenRemovalTimestamps[execHash] = 1 (contracts/L2_NovaRegistry.sol#309)

description:
L2_NovaRegistry.areTokensRemoved(bytes32) (contracts/L2_NovaRegistry.sol#353-386) uses timestamp for comparisons
	Dangerous comparisons:
	- removalTimestamp == 0 (contracts/L2_NovaRegistry.sol#356)
	- uncleDeathTimestamp == 1 (contracts/L2_NovaRegistry.sol#369)
	- tokensRemoved = block.timestamp < uncleDeathTimestamp (contracts/L2_NovaRegistry.sol#375)
	- tokensRemoved = block.timestamp >= removalTimestamp (contracts/L2_NovaRegistry.sol#383)
markdown:

	Dangerous comparisons:
	- [removalTimestamp == 0](contracts/L2_NovaRegistry.sol#L356)
	- [uncleDeathTimestamp == 1](contracts/L2_NovaRegistry.sol#L369)
	- [tokensRemoved = block.timestamp < uncleDeathTimestamp](contracts/L2_NovaRegistry.sol#L375)
	- [tokensRemoved = block.timestamp >= removalTimestamp](contracts/L2_NovaRegistry.sol#L383)
